seems to me educational radio does need it now.
Educational radio has flown by the seat of its pants for
a good many years and it will be in trouble if it ever gets
so organised and systematized and categorized that it is
void of inspiration. But now that we are in the limelight,
albeit a limelight prismatically reflected through an ETV
lens, it is important that our inspiration fall within a
framework of defined purpose.
Educational radio is many things, possibly more things than
ETV. But, perhaps because we have never sustained the
buffeting that presently perplexes ETV we have never drawn
boundaries clearly delineating what we think is our purpose.
Despite our national organization (which itself is suffering
from lack of definition) and our frequent get-togethers and
talk-togethers, educational radio does not describe an
activity with easily recognizable parameters.
And X think we ve tended to keep it that way on purpose.
1 think with all our talk we haven81 been entirely open
with each other, we haven’t really wanted to pry beneath
our conscious concerns.
